extendedInfo.description: Display your favourite pictures, animations, webcams, galleries and websites as a live wallpaper! Create your own personal (animated) wallpaper with JavaScript!*NOTE: If you are having trouble, first consult the FAQ (Developer Website below).**For bugs, extra help, feature requests and general comments, email the creator or visit the development thread linked in the FAQ **Please report all crashes to the developer! If possible add the website you tried when the crash happened to the crash report! *As an avid windsurfer I like to watch my home beach even on workdays and see what's going on. Maybe I have to take a vacation if the conditions are great. This live background enables me to always keep an eye on the spot.WebLiveWallpaper can display a local picture gallery, download images from websites, show a webcam stream, and much more.Use WebLiveWallpaper to:*Cycle images from a folder on your device.*Download a static image from a website.*Display images from an online picture gallery, such as Facebook, Picasa, Flickr, Deviantart and all others.*Show static images from a webcam.*Display a webcam stream.*Display small animated GIFs.*Show snapshots from websites, including all elements viewable on your devices browser. *Display animated JavaScript/CSS websites.Other features include:*A large selection of examples to choose and learn from.*Advanced modifications made through XML.*Specify refresh times, with different times for Wifi and 3G if desired.*Specify daily activity start and stop times.*Set Wifi-only mode to limit data usage.*Specify Login/Password for private sites.*Create a custom slideshow taking content from different sites.*Choose to save every image, and whether to store on your SD card or on main memory.*If viewing webcam images, choose to avoid night-time images.To enable WebLiveWallpaper: 1. Long press on the home screen, or press , and select âWallpaperâ2. Select âLive Wallpapersâ3. Select âWebLiveWallpaperâ4. Select âSet as BackgroundâAny site can be selected as a Live Wallpaper by WebLiveWallpaper.  WebLiveWallpaper can display an image taken from a site, or a snapshot of the site itself.  Selecting your favourite site to use as a Live Wallpaper is as simple as entering a URL:1. Open WebLiveWallpaper either from âAll Appsâ, or from the Live Wallpaper screen.2. Select âSettingsâ3. Select the tab âNewâ4. Tap âEnter URLâ, and type in your siteâs URL.Alternatively you can simply browse to the site:1. Open your devices web browser.2. Browse to the website you wish to add as a Live Wallpaper.3. Long press on the siteâs URL, select âShareâ, and then select âWebLiveWallpaperâ.FAQ: Open Developer Website below (http://www.dngames.de/weblivewallpaper/faq.html)

reviews.title: Been looking for somethign like this for months
reviews.comment: Trying to find a home-screen widget that can show realtime daily stocks progress.  Nothing exists.  However, I can direct this widget to yahoo or google finance stock charts and have updated daily stocks progress graphs.  So cool!!!
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Great!
reviews.comment: Works great. The only issue I personally have is, if I want to change the timed refresh interval, I have to create a new \"saved site setting\". I\'d much rather it just be in the \"System\" config as a universal setting than a \"new saved site setting\". Maybe you could add an \"override saved setting for refresh with ____ seconds\" checkbox option, that would be nice, but, it\'s really a minor thing, because how often do you need to change those settings, as opposed to the amount of time to code/debug for adding my requested addition which isn\'t needed for the app to function properly.
reviews.author: Jay H

reviews.title: View the World
reviews.comment: A great application that Just keeps getting better,thank you.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: good if configured correctly
reviews.comment: I write a PHP script that redirects to the desired wallpaper, and setup this app to fetch that script URI hourly. View mode must be \"no border\" to get a good view.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Hmm
reviews.comment: Live web cam wallpapers are pretty awesome. Devs should split this app into webcam only and the rest of wallpaper features can go over to picofday.  \"My show\" feature is really buggy and my phone kept refreshing even though I\'ve set a large number 20000 secs. So it eventually ate all my RAM.  Get some live aquarium feed cuz that\'d be cool. The delete self created \"My site\" should be place at the my site creation page. It\'s really hard to find.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Cool...
reviews.comment: Awesome!  allows me to setup background images with website.  Stream netflix over backgrounds... Hmmm... Will have to test that one...
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Love it but would like one more feature
reviews.comment: Love it! Would be great if we could add gallery pictures to the rotation with webcams.
reviews.author: Lazarus Guisso

reviews.title: Does the job beautifully
reviews.comment: This is awesome work. It does exactly what I need.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Good idea, but...
reviews.comment: Tried and failed for hours (at least 4 hours) to set it up to automatically change my galaxy s3 wallpaper from wallbase.cc every 10 seconds. Googled different settings, tried at least 30 different settings options combinations, nothing helped. Settings sometimes don\'t save at all, errors don\'t display until i set show progress, images that do load, load incorrectly (I think this is due to settings not being saved), and some images get stuck (not refreshing with blank screen if no images are found with new settings). Seems like a great idea, but waaay to hard to make it work with custom website like wallbase.cc
reviews.author: Geno A

reviews.title: Streaming web cam wallpaper
reviews.comment: Works  pretty good.
